reviews.title: Overnight stay
reviews.text: A very nice family run hotel. Traditional in style but looked like it had recently had a makeover. I was impressed that access to public areas and particularly the bedrooms had taken account for less able bodied guests, wide doors, lift and the en suite bathroom had hand rails and a seat in the shower. Bedrooms are large with comfortable beds and plenty of soft towels. Very small tv but compensated with free wifi. Nice bar area with open fire and plenty of seating. Continental breakfast with all the usual suspects, good start to the day. We only had the one night here but would have been happy to stay for longer if we hadn't already booked a week in Chamonix.

reviews.title: charming idiosyncratic hotel -- great family rooms

reviews.text: This is a pleasant family-run hotel with interesting decor, super suites for families, and very welcoming staff. Some things may not work as smoothly as you might want (see other complaining reviews) -- in our case there were several blown light bulbs in our room and a wonky door handle. But for goodness sake you're in Italy for the warmth of the people, the joie de vivre, the mountains, the food. If you want a super-efficient holiday where everything in the hotel runs like clockwork, please holiday in Germany. Leave Italy to those of us who appreciate its charms and don't mind a bit of chaos or imperfection in return!
reviews.title: I liked it so much I came back a week later

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took the blown light bulbs out of the lamps and took them down to reception to get replacements. The elderly lady there rummaged about in a shoe box, she and I conversing in a Franco-Itlaliano-Inglese hybrid, with lots of gesticulations and laughs. I repaired the door handle myself -- less than a minute with my Swiss army knife. Big deal.
reviews.title: Hotel Svizzero
cosy and comfy!
reviews.text: The family rooms are fantastic -- we had a living area with two lofts: three children in one loft and we were in the other. Perfect arrangement for us. The food was not spectacular but very good, and quite varied, and served by three very pleasant waiters. We didn't have a disappointing dish. The girl behind the bar taught me some Italian whilst serving me a Campari, and I taught her some English. Fair swap.
